<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>This week, for the first time in 14 months, I attended a live sporting event. And for a snoozefest between a team I hate (the Yankees) and a team that’s fielding a minor league roster (the Orioles), it was glorious. I was able to catch up with old friends, dangle my feet over a stadium chair, and pay $12.99 for a Bud Light (#grateful). </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The pandemic has helped me appreciate the things I’d previously taken for granted, whether it’s happy hour with coworkers or live sports on a random weeknight. As the crisis winds down, the opportunity to do those activities will pick up again. The key will be to treat them all like a Yankees-Orioles game in April 2021.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">—Neal</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500"></p>
</div>
</td>

<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Stock Watch: Billionaires
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Bernie Sanders doesn’t think they should exist; Bruno Mars wants to be one so frickin’ bad. This week on Stock Watch, we’re charting billionaires throughout history.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg1L3N0b2NrX3dhdGNoX2JpbGxpb25haXJlcy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<td align="left" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; word-break: break-word;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">

Q&A
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers With…Cassey Ho
</h1>
<img alt="A photograph of Blogilates founder Cassey Ho. She is smiling widely, wearing mint biker shorts and matching bra; and sitting on the floor with her left leg stretched out and right hand touching her head. " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njc0L2Nhc3NleV9ob18zLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Blogilates</em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you've ever genuinely cracked a smile three sets deep into a grueling ab workout, it's almost certainly because you were being coached by Pilates guru <a href="https://www.instagram.com/blogilates/?hl=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cassey Ho</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Cassey has posted workouts and blogged under the Blogilates brand for 12 years. As CEO, she turned free YouTube Pilates classes into a health and fitness empire, expanded into gyms, built an app, created a thriving activewear brand, and much more.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We asked Cassey some icebreaker questions to learn how she's held onto her digital crown. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You've been working in the public eye for 12 years. How have you learned to grow as a person while keeping your audience along for the ride?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">When I first started, I was trying to keep fans happy, but there comes a point when the fans are telling you who to be instead of you leading them. And I got stuck in a place where I began to get super scared of upsetting people.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In 2019, I decided to go on my <a href="https://www.blogilates.com/category/90-day-journey/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">90-day journey</a>, not just for physical reasons, but also for mental reasons, emotional reasons…[I discovered] myself, finding my confidence and my strength again, and in all natural ways—eating healthy and working out.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Do you create for different platforms with a different audience in mind? </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It's like talking to different siblings; they just need to be talked to differently if you want a certain result. How I'm going to talk to someone on TikTok is different than how I'm going to talk to them on Facebook.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Instagram users are eating up Reels because I think there is a sect that is not willing to go on TikTok. So that's one place where I’m able to use the same content on both platforms.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You only get to use two condiments for the rest of your life. What are they?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Sriracha and Everything but the Elote Seasoning from Trader Joe's. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Best concert?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/2CELLOSlive?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2CELLOS</a>. They are these two guys who play the cello, but really hardcore. Classical music with this rocker twist.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What question do you wish people asked you more?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Would you like to have dessert? I'm always asking people, and they're like, "No, we're full."</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>How does an established YouTuber, blogger, and Instagrammer translate that success to TikTok? How do you stay authentic when you are the brand? Read the </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/11/blogilates-cassey-ho-learned-run-fitness-social-media-empire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>rest of our interview</em></a><em> with Cassey to find out.</em></p>


</div>
</td>
</tr>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
WORK LIFE
</p>

<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
For Non-Cringe Team Bonding Activities, Just Ask
</h1>
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew’s Head of People Ops Kate Noel will answer <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>I am a manager of a team of 10 people, and we could use some bonding after working remotely for a year. Do you have any ideas for non-cringe virtual activities? —</strong><strong>Dan from Detroit</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hey Dan, thanks for writing in! As the Head of People Ops, I like to think of myself as the leader of fun, so coming up with team events is my specialty. During Covid, I've helped Morning Brew host trivia nights, socially distanced picnics, a virtual drag show, a magic show, and a virtual escape room, just to name a few. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In your case, I would suggest you ask your team members what they are interested in. What might be considered cringe for one group might be super fun for another! So getting their insight would cut out a lot of the guesswork. Another great resource is <a href="https://www.groupon.com/?&utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=us_dt_sea_ggl_txt_naq_sr_cbp_ch1_ybr_k*groupon_m*e_d*groupon-brand_g*groupon-exact_c*319223768635_ap*&gclid=CjwKCAjw9r-DBhBxEiwA9qYUpaypciOlYtVcUr24juu8dXJhadtwqWVkwtN3uZWS-GuzxHF6TqO-KhoCA4oQAvD_BwE&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Groupon</a>. Prior to the pandemic, Groupon vendors held their events in person but had to pivot to virtual experiences once the world lowkey shutdown. You will be surprised at all the creative ideas that now exist for groups of different sizes. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hope that helps, and be sure to let us know what you end up kicking things off with! </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Is it okay to eat during Zoom meetings? —Avery in Santa Clara, CA</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">My HR-safe<strong> </strong>answer? "No." My real-life answer? "Read the room, boo!" All Zoom meetings are not created equal. If it’s with your closest teammates, it’s probably nbd. But if you feel nervous about eating your sushi on camera, then you might want to wait until after the awkward goodbye waves at the end of your meeting. Not for nothing, you could probably get away with keeping your video off during a larger group meeting to eat food. But at your own risk, so choose your own adventure. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Kate for advice here</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">

<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The Big Ballot Showdown at the Arctic Circle
</h1>
<img alt="Greenland ballot " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njc1L2dyZWVubGFuZF9iYWxsb3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>EMIL HELMS/Ritzau Scanpix/AFP via Getty Images</em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">When Greenland pops up in the news, it means one of three things: a) global warming is getting worse, b) someone wants to buy it, or c) a dramatic election took place over a rare earths mining project with implications for US national security.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In fact, there <em>was </em>a fierce election held there last week with global ramifications. But first, because there’s no such thing as a stupid question….</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">What <em>is </em>Greenland? </h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The island that dominated the top part of the map in your high school classroom is a <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-18249474?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">semiautonomous territory</a> of Denmark, not an independent country. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s pretty empty: About 57,000 people live there, despite the landmass being big enough to cover more than 20% of the US. The only economic game in town is fishing, which is why Denmark provides two-thirds of Greenland’s budget and handles its monetary and military affairs.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But like Dippin' Dots, there’s so much <em>potential</em>, and that’s what this <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/04/06/984768012/a-row-over-rare-earth-deposits-could-bring-down-greenlands-government?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">election</a> was all about. Greenland sits on one of the world’s biggest deposits of rare earth elements, minerals that are required for the production of modern machines like fighter planes, electric vehicles, and smartphones. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">After years of paperwork, a Chinese-backed Australian mining company was ready to tap these reserves. But then opponents called for a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinas-rare-earths-quest-upends-greenlands-government-11617807839?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">snap election</a> to stop the project in its tracks...and it worked. On Wednesday, the pro-environment Inuit Ataqatigiit (IA) party wrested power away from the Siumut party, which had supported the project.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1">
<span>The IA party isn’t opposed to </span><span><em>all </em></span><span>mining, just this particular development, which critics say could release radioactive waste into the fragile environment that surrounds the site.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">A lot is at stake </h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">For Greenland and for the US, China, Russia, or anyone else that considers themselves a global superpower.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>For Greenland: </strong>Many Greenlanders want independence from Denmark, but the only way that can happen is to wean themselves off Danish payments. The economic boom generated from rare earth mines could be their ticket out. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>For the US: </strong>With China controlling over 70% of rare earth mining, the US is eyeing Greenland’s reserves (about 10% of the world’s rare earths) as a way to become less reliant on China for these critical raw materials.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>For the rest of the world: </strong>Greenland is becoming the hottest destination this side of South Beach. As climate change melts away Greenland’s ice sheet, shipping routes are opening up that could <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/read/over-the-top-arctic-shipping-lanes?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut travel times</a> from Asia to Europe in half, which, if you know anything about the traffic at the Suez Canal (and you do), is quite attractive. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Bottom line: </strong>When former President Trump floated the idea of buying Greenland in 2019, everyone had a good laugh, paused for a second, then went, “Hmmmm, not a terrible idea.” Expect the battle over Greenland, and within Greenland itself, to heat up in the next few years.</p>

Open House
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">For today’s Open House entry, we’re taking y’all down to Waco, Texas, in honor of the new men’s college basketball champions. Try to guess the listing price of this <a href="https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/18-Carriage-Sq-Waco-TX-76708/52092494_zpid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lone Star house</a> based on several facts and pictures.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">  <img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/VOstJHsFyDsSIkLPxw/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Zillow</em> </small></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you liked cheering on Baylor, you’ll love living 12 minutes from campus in this luxurious 4,444 square-foot house built in 1982. Amenities include:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>5 beds, 4 baths</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A pool surrounded by giant oak trees for secret pool parties (nothing weird, just secret)</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>3 fireplaces</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A master bedroom with a sitting area, perfect for resting before a long night of sleeping</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much do you think it costs?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">$725,000</p>

</h1>
<div class="mb-6 bg-gray-100 rounded p-4">
<div class="internal-content">
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">1. The annual Forbes billionaire list dropped this week. Here are five things you need to know. (<a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1379903303878914052?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">2. Revenge of the Winklevii: Your annual think piece on America’s favorite bitcoin billionaire twins. (<a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/michaeldelcastillo/2021/04/05/revenge-of-the-winklevii-facebook-winklevoss-bitcoin-nft-billionaire-revenge/?sh=3cffc0591572&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Forbes</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">3. Tracking the front page of the New York Times. <p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">4. How fit can you get just from walking? (<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/get-fit-from-just-walking?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GQ</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">5. Please enjoy these pictures of a vaccinated nursing home dance party. (<a href="https://patch.com/california/northhollywood/please-enjoy-these-pictures-nursing-home-dance-party?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Patch</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">6. Don’t pick up! The rise and fall of a massive industry based on missed calls. (<a href="https://restofworld.org/2021/the-rise-and-fall-of-missed-calls-in-india/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rest of World</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">7. How one psychologist changed the meaning of memory. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/04/05/how-elizabeth-loftus-changed-the-meaning-of-memory?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">8. Did Boomers ruin America? A debate. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/06/opinion/ezra-klein-podcast-helen-andrews-jill-filipovic-boomers.html?action=click&module=Opinion&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">9. America’s “crumbling” roads and bridges are fine. (<a href="https://www.slowboring.com/p/roads-and-bridges?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo0NjE1OTIsInBvc3RfaWQiOjM0Nzk1MjUxLCJfIjoiVG8wTmsiLCJpYXQiOjE2MTc4MjkxOTYsImV4cCI6MTYxNzgzMjc5NiwiaXNzIjoicHViLTE1OTE4NSIsInN1YiI6InBvc3QtcmVhY3Rpb24ifQ.NT3q962Wb-dDtki5X09j-gAXHzkd2lnoEbLMFBSZi5s&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Slow Boring</a>)</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">10. 10 years of Nyan cat: the famed GIF’s creator on hitting the meme jackpot. (<a href="https://www.inputmag.com/culture/nyan-cat-meme-gif-nft-10th-birthday-chris-torres-history?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Input</a>) </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>The ultra wealthy love this asset class. </strong>84% of ultra-high-net-worth individuals collect art according to Deloitte. And It makes sense—contemporary art prices outperformed the S&P 500 by 172% over the last 25 years. <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=4-11-21&utm_term=Morning%20Brew%20Subscribers&utm_content=bets&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Masterworks</a> lets you invest in multi-million dollar art, just like the pros. #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eThis week, for the first time in 14 months, I attended a live sporting event. And for a snoozefest between a team I hate (the Yankees) and a team that’s fielding a minor league roster (the Orioles), it was glorious. I was able to catch up with old friends, dangle my feet over a stadium chair, and pay $12.99 for a Bud Light (#grateful). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe pandemic has helped me appreciate the things I’d previously taken for granted, whether it’s happy hour with coworkers or live sports on a random weeknight. As the crisis winds down, the opportunity to do those activities will pick up again. The key will be to treat them all like a Yankees-Orioles game in April 2021.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e—Neal\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; She is smiling widely, wearing mint biker shorts and matching bra; and sitting on the floor with her left leg stretched out and right hand touching her head. \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njc0L2Nhc3NleV9ob18zLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eBlogilates\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you've ever genuinely cracked a smile three sets deep into a grueling ab workout, it's almost certainly because you were being coached by Pilates guru \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/blogilates/?hl=en\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCassey Ho\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eCassey has posted workouts and blogged under the Blogilates brand for 12 years. As CEO, she turned free YouTube Pilates classes into a health and fitness empire, expanded into gyms, built an app, created a thriving activewear brand, and much more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe asked Cassey some icebreaker questions to learn how she's held onto her digital crown. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou've been working in the public eye for 12 years. How have you learned to grow as a person while keeping your audience along for the ride?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhen I first started, I was trying to keep fans happy, but there comes a point when the fans are telling you who to be instead of you leading them. And I got stuck in a place where I began to get super scared of upsetting people.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn 2019, I decided to go on my \u003ca href=\"https://www.blogilates.com/category/90-day-journey/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e90-day journey\u003c/a\u003e, not just for physical reasons, but also for mental reasons, emotional reasons…[I discovered] myself, finding my confidence and my strength again, and in all natural ways—eating healthy and working out.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDo you create for different platforms with a different audience in mind? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt's like talking to different siblings; they just need to be talked to differently if you want a certain result. How I'm going to talk to someone on TikTok is different than how I'm going to talk to them on Facebook.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eInstagram users are eating up Reels because I think there is a sect that is not willing to go on TikTok. So that's one place where I’m able to use the same content on both platforms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou only get to use two condiments for the rest of your life. What are they?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSriracha and Everything but the Elote Seasoning from Trader Joe's. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBest concert?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/2CELLOSlive?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2CELLOS\u003c/a\u003e. They are these two guys who play the cello, but really hardcore. Classical music with this rocker twist.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat question do you wish people asked you more?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWould you like to have dessert? I'm always asking people, and they're like, \"No, we're full.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow does an established YouTuber, blogger, and Instagrammer translate that success to TikTok? How do you stay authentic when you are the brand? Read the \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/11/blogilates-cassey-ho-learned-run-fitness-social-media-empire?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003erest of our interview\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e with Cassey to find out.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- END SOCIAL LINKS - --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- END ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003c!-- SPONSORED SECTION --\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nFor Non-Cringe Team Bonding Activities, Just Ask\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make It Work logo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew’s Head of People Ops Kate Noel will answer \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eI am a manager of a team of 10 people, and we could use some bonding after working remotely for a year. Do you have any ideas for non-cringe virtual activities? —\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDan from Detroit\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHey Dan, thanks for writing in! As the Head of People Ops, I like to think of myself as the leader of fun, so coming up with team events is my specialty. During Covid, I've helped Morning Brew host trivia nights, socially distanced picnics, a virtual drag show, a magic show, and a virtual escape room, just to name a few. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn your case, I would suggest you ask your team members what they are interested in. What might be considered cringe for one group might be super fun for another! So getting their insight would cut out a lot of the guesswork. Another great resource is \u003ca href=\"https://www.groupon.com/?\u0026utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=cpc\u0026utm_campaign=us_dt_sea_ggl_txt_naq_sr_cbp_ch1_ybr_k*groupon_m*e_d*groupon-brand_g*groupon-exact_c*319223768635_ap*\u0026gclid=CjwKCAjw9r-DBhBxEiwA9qYUpaypciOlYtVcUr24juu8dXJhadtwqWVkwtN3uZWS-GuzxHF6TqO-KhoCA4oQAvD_BwE\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGroupon\u003c/a\u003e. Prior to the pandemic, Groupon vendors held their events in person but had to pivot to virtual experiences once the world lowkey shutdown. You will be surprised at all the creative ideas that now exist for groups of different sizes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHope that helps, and be sure to let us know what you end up kicking things off with! \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs it okay to eat during Zoom meetings? —Avery in Santa Clara, CA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eMy HR-safe\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eanswer? \"No.\" My real-life answer? \"Read the room, boo!\" All Zoom meetings are not created equal. If it’s with your closest teammates, it’s probably nbd. But if you feel nervous about eating your sushi on camera, then you might want to wait until after the awkward goodbye waves at the end of your meeting. Not for nothing, you could probably get away with keeping your video off during a larger group meeting to eat food. But at your own risk, so choose your own adventure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Kate for advice here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F09%2Fask-hr-can-eat-zoom-meetings\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;\"\u003e\nANALYSIS \n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd width=\"33%\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;\"\u003e\n \n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"column\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe Big Ballot Showdown at the Arctic Circle\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Greenland ballot \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njc1L2dyZWVubGFuZF9iYWxsb3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eEMIL HELMS/Ritzau Scanpix/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhen Greenland pops up in the news, it means one of three things: a) global warming is getting worse, b) someone wants to buy it, or c) a dramatic election took place over a rare earths mining project with implications for US national security.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn fact, there \u003cem\u003ewas \u003c/em\u003ea fierce election held there last week with global ramifications. But first, because there’s no such thing as a stupid question….\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eWhat \u003cem\u003eis \u003c/em\u003eGreenland? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe island that dominated the top part of the map in your high school classroom is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-18249474?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esemiautonomous territory\u003c/a\u003e of Denmark, not an independent country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt’s pretty empty: About 57,000 people live there, despite the landmass being big enough to cover more than 20% of the US. The only economic game in town is fishing, which is why Denmark provides two-thirds of Greenland’s budget and handles its monetary and military affairs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut like Dippin' Dots, there’s so much \u003cem\u003epotential\u003c/em\u003e, and that’s what this \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/04/06/984768012/a-row-over-rare-earth-deposits-could-bring-down-greenlands-government?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eelection\u003c/a\u003e was all about. Greenland sits on one of the world’s biggest deposits of rare earth elements, minerals that are required for the production of modern machines like fighter planes, electric vehicles, and smartphones. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAfter years of paperwork, a Chinese-backed Australian mining company was ready to tap these reserves. But then opponents called for a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinas-rare-earths-quest-upends-greenlands-government-11617807839?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esnap election\u003c/a\u003e to stop the project in its tracks...and it worked. On Wednesday, the pro-environment Inuit Ataqatigiit (IA) party wrested power away from the Siumut party, which had supported the project.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe IA party isn’t opposed to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eall \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emining, just this particular development, which critics say could release radioactive waste into the fragile environment that surrounds the site.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eA lot is at stake \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFor Greenland and for the US, China, Russia, or anyone else that considers themselves a global superpower.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFor Greenland: \u003c/strong\u003eMany Greenlanders want independence from Denmark, but the only way that can happen is to wean themselves off Danish payments. The economic boom generated from rare earth mines could be their ticket out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFor the US: \u003c/strong\u003eWith China controlling over 70% of rare earth mining, the US is eyeing Greenland’s reserves (about 10% of the world’s rare earths) as a way to become less reliant on China for these critical raw materials.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFor the rest of the world: \u003c/strong\u003eGreenland is becoming the hottest destination this side of South Beach. As climate change melts away Greenland’s ice sheet, shipping routes are opening up that could \u003ca href=\"https://www.gzeromedia.com/read/over-the-top-arctic-shipping-lanes?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut travel times\u003c/a\u003e from Asia to Europe in half, which, if you know anything about the traffic at the Suez Canal (and you do), is quite attractive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen former President Trump floated the idea of buying Greenland in 2019, everyone had a good laugh, paused for a second, then went, “Hmmmm, not a terrible idea.” Expect the battle over Greenland, and within Greenland itself, to heat up in the next few years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F09%2Fbig-ballot-showdown-arctic-circle\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
